intro: Ormosia amazonica var. venenifera, commonly known as the Amazonian poisonwood, is a species native to the rainforests of South America. It is a small evergreen tree or shrub that typically grows in the understory of humid tropical forests. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, clustered flowers that are often white or pale yellow. Its most notable feature is the presence of toxic compounds in its leaves and bark, which have been used historically by indigenous communities for various purposes. The species plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, contributing to biodiversity and soil stability.
